full_summary:
*Tender Notice: Droplet Digital Polymerase Chain Reaction System*
==============================================

### Official Reference

* Reference Number: WS4015452306-Doc4036001721
* Solicitation Number: WS4015452306
* Tender Closing Date: Tuesday, June 19, 2023, 2:00 PM (EDT)

### Notice Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) issues this Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) for the procurement of a Droplet Digital Polymerase Chain Reaction System (ddPCR). This is an open and competitive solicitation process.

### Procurement Details

* Procurement Category: Goods and Services (GD)
* Procurement Method: Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)
* Notice Type: Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)
* Expected Contract Start Date: July 1, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: August 31, 2024

### Relevant Standards and Agreements

* The procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, and Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement.

### Delivery and Delivery Region

* The delivery region is the National Capital Region (NCR).

### Contracting Entity and End User

* The contracting entity is the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC).
* The end user is the Department of Health (HC).

### Contact Information

For further information, please contact:
Vanessa Burns
Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC)
Phone: None
Email: [vanessa.burns@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:vanessa.burns@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

### Related Documents

Please visit the following URL to access the solicitation documents: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16461067?extsite=MTY0NjEwNjdfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

Note: The solicitation is closed; hence, no quotations will be accepted.

### Important Details

* This is an international trade contract, and the goods and services provided must comply with the relevant international trade agreements.
* The contracting entity reserves the right to negotiate with bidders and to award the contract to the bidder who submits the most advantageous quotation in terms of the tender evaluation criteria
